先看我时长，我四个难度都通了一遍，1999额外通了一遍，大家都在说剧情优秀，也确实，但在这我重点说说游戏性吧
1999通关率只有2%，但其实没那么难，每个难度打上来，你就会变得熟练，最后乱杀。
药水的话先升护盾再升魔力，血量几乎不用升，升魔力有一个特点就是你能回满魔力，所以中途缺魔力时交替升是可以的。
武器方面，个人推荐至少一把大狙，不仅一些特殊关卡必须用到，本身用来打远距离的爱国者和机枪机关也很好用。
另一把用霰弹枪或榴弹枪清小兵一下一个，用非革命军版的。革命军的武器感觉挺莫名其妙的，没什么神器。
技能野马和乌鸦选一个升，都是清杂兵的神器。乌鸦更克制巨臂匠，但几乎没法爆头，打小兵一枪一个没事，但打小boss就不如野马，野马更克制乌鸦人和燃烧人，并且容易爆头。另一个升磁铁技能，它后期才出现，很无敌，但完全升级费用要2000左右，前期记得攒钱。雷霆的延长时间可以升，电机关可以帮你节省大狙弹药。别的技能后期可能意义不大，但冲水技能能让飞艇上的一堆敌人全部掉出地图，还可以。高射炮兵又肉射程又远伤害还高，建议用爱心迷惑他然后然后让他自杀。值得注意的是，一些奖励房间需要用雷霆或火焰才能打开，别漏了呀。
这游戏场景是真的新奇有趣，敌人可能种类不是特别多，但光是战斗场景就值得你游玩好几遍了。前期出现巨臂匠的关卡会比较难，像夺取飞艇那关我死了好多次。本来想一命通关就回检查点继续打了，结果还是打不赢，只能丢几百块钱了哈哈哈。有些地方的东西拿了算偷，这里说明一下，许多场景是会走回来的，除了芬克镇的套装以外别的地方不用打架，回来再拿完全ok。
提到套装，这里说说一些强力套装，前期拿到你就是狗托！
帽子强化野马的很强，减少机关攻击范围的也不错
上衣杀人掉备弹或者杀人掉蓝或者增加可装填弹药的都可以
裤子这里强烈推荐残血杀人能回大量血的那个，靠它我活下来很多次了！如果你打小boss，那提升50%爆头伤害绝对适合你，野马一吹，大狙爆头5000血，一枪带走乌鸦人或燃烧人，爽！基本这两件裤子来回换，看你打的是一堆小兵还是小boss了。
好用的鞋子真的不多，杀人能电击周围敌人的特别猛，但我第二次打1999难度时拿了那么多套装愣是没有，老非酋了！
最后，可以告诉你们的是，如果你有这两件套装，你打有空轨的关卡可以完全无视我上面的建议——鞋子牛顿定律和上衣寒冬护盾。寒冬护盾能让你从空轨落下来时无敌整整10秒，牛顿定律可以让你的空轨突袭概率秒杀小Boss,也就是乌鸦人，燃烧人，爱国者甚至是巨臂匠！可以不费一枪一弹，而且一滴血，甚至一格护盾都不掉打赢游戏，因为你可以来回跳啊！很多人说最后一关超难打，不是自己被秒就是战舰被摧毁。告诉你，我第二次打1999时用这个套路穿梭于空轨之间，战舰甚至10%的血都没掉，因为来打的所有人都被我瞬秒，包括令人头疼的一堆爱国者，而我1%的护盾都没掉，因为我完全就是无敌嘛。我甚至觉得打得太快了，敌人太少了！
不过，如果你是打折期间心动刚买无限，看到这条评论就心血来潮，想直接挑战困难（二周目才有1999）的玩家，我还是劝你先从简单开始，好好先感受剧情的魅力，其他周目再提升难度。真觉得太简单中途可以调难度（1999不能调）。其实结局挺揪心的，唉！！！
码字不易，各位顺手推荐一下吧，求求了！

Warning: LONG REVIEW, LIGHT SPOILERS

Initially, I was going to give Bioshock Infinite a recommendation, with deep sadness in my heart perhaps, but still. But after a ridiculously tedious boss fight repeated three (!) times and insanely drown-out dull corridor shootouts with dummy AI and most importantly, increasingly inane, needlessly complicated plot about multiverses, that tries to be so important, complex and meaningful, but ends up just being pretentious and collapses on itself, I am doing the unthinkable and giving this "masterpiece" a thumbs down. What once started as an ambitious experiment with the first two System Shock titles, that revolutionized public's perception of first-person action games has now ingloriously devolved into a typical linear shooter with slightly more complex themes than its peers. I am kind of shocked (pun intended) that this has 94 on Metacritic. Then again, I always thought 96 for the original Bioshock was also too much. But Infinite is a whole different league. Save for storytelling, voice acting and excellent setting design, I really can't think of any other aspect in which Infinite truly excels. It is actually sad, that this game is held up as a "masterpiece" or an example of video games as art. Unless there's a huge discount (75-80%, not less), I wouldn’t recommend buying this game. 

Let's get this out of the way first – Bioshock Infinite is a first-person shooter. Not an RPG, an action RPG or even a shooter with some light RPG elements. It is a straight-up linear shooter with RPG cosmetics at best, no ifs or buts about it. There is literally nothing here that even remotely smacks of old Bioshock: there's no hacking, no research, no mini-games, no cameras, no crafting, no upgrades unless you count the most basic bare-bone ones and there’s pretty much zero exploration. Manual save option and the ability to carry more than two weapons are also missing. Gone is the depressing atmosphere in a bizarre hostile world you were merely trying to survive. Gone are small callbacks Bioshock 1 and 2 had to original System Shocks. Now you can't even carry medkits! The only thing you can do is trudge through corridors killing the same types of enemies again and again. Oh, and picking up audio recordings and other "stuff". No strategy or tactics required. I am surprised the game does not have regenerating health and Captain Price cameo somewhere. Although you still get – wait for it – a regenerating shield. Yeap, a regenerating shield in a Shock game. We lived long enough to see it.  

Mechanically speaking, even Rage 2 – an average game that does not even pretend to be anything more than full-blown fun shooting experience – has more actual RPG elements, as you can upgrade your multiple abilities, guns and vehicles in far more ways than in Infinite. Let that sink in: Rage 2 is more of an RPG than Bioshock Infinite. Even the original Dead Space had a more meaningful and extensive upgrade system, for crying out loud.    

I still don't understand: why streamline (read: dumb down) to THIS extent? Was the original Bioshock really all that complex? Were there actually people, who thought that it required too much thought and effort to play? I can only imagine what they would think if they booted up System Shock 2. 

While Bioshock Infinite is a shooter, it not even a good one: it is quite a linear, on-rails experience and the AI is dumb as bricks. The latter levels are a chore, as the game throws dozens of bullet-sponge enemies at you in order to offer at least some kind of challenge. The melee types charge you out in the open like complete morons. In previous games those foes were basically robots or mindless zombies, so it was understandable. In Infinite's Columbia, I guess cops are just suicidal idiots attacking you head-on with batons. The ghost boss fight mentioned earlier is an insanely tedious affair, unless you exploit enemy AI. Generally, Shock games always felt at least somewhat grounded, even when they had supernatural elements. Infinite goes way too far with the multiple dimension mumbo-jumbo and weird ghost nonsense. Yes, Shock games were odd, but at least they tried to logically explain it somehow. Infinite does not even bother. It expects to take all these preposterous occurrences at face value. 

I also wanted to add on the lack of good characters. There is the boring main character, your "sidekick" Elizabeth, the evil religious cult leader, the twins, who appear here and there and… that's It. There are other side characters sure – Fitzroy, Fink, Slate – who appear to be interesting characters at least on paper, but none of them are explored in any depth. The closest we get to a deep character is probably Slate and even he is wasted.  

The biggest problem, however, is that the whole story and setting have a nasty tinge of artificiality to them. In Bioshock, plasmids and ADAM and Rapture were deeply intertwined, but in Columbia, they are there, because... well, it's a Bioshock game and we gotta have them. The same goes for other details. Vending machines selling you guns and ammunition made sense in the hyper-free market world of Rapture. But in Columbia, with its deep class divisions and conflicts simmering, I just can't see guns being sold so openly out in literal vending machines. There's even a subplot in the game to get more guns for the oppressed Vox Populi underclass, despite the fact that they are sold right there in the street. Or do they only sell gun upgrades, but not weapons themselves? I don’t know. In any case, these machines, as small of a detail as they may seem, went from being integral part of the world to just another video game spot to get more "stuff". Story-wise, Bioshock Infinite is just a chaotic mess that seems to be cleaved in two separate parts: the Columbia part (setting) and whatever pretentious story about multidimensions Ken Levine thought up. They seem to be at odds with each other, almost like they don't belong there. I don't know maybe that was the idea, but it still takes me out of experience and makes me realize I am playing yet another shooter with gimmicky and pretentious ideas about timelines (2010’s Bioshock-light clone Singularity sprang to my mind numerous times while playing, especially towards the end). 

I barely finished the game and my reward was one of the most confusing endings I have ever witnessed, that unloaded tons of "revelations" in the last 15 minutes. But if you really dig deep enough, you understand how truly shallow the game's narrative is and how it tries to mask it with needlessly complicated multiple dimension garbage, which has no relation whatsoever to Columbia or Rapture. Really, what integral connection is there between the setting of early 20th century fantasy-world of Columbia and the insanely convoluted story about multiverses and time loops? I failed to see any. The game might as well have been set in Ancient Rome or 25th century Martian colony and it would not have changed anything about the gist of the story. The basic narrative would have stayed the same mess devoid of actual themes other than redemption, I guess. Even that was done woefully poorly – Call of Juarez: The Gunslinger did a redemption arc in much more satisfying ways in just few lines of dialogue and with a tiny fraction of Infinite's budget, the very same year Infinite was unleashed on unsuspecting public, by the way. 

Finally, the Burial at Sea DLC – I won’t say much about it, except it looked promising at first, but ended up almost laughable in its pretentiousness. I won’t spoil much, but at times I legitimately thought I was watching a comedy sketch based on Bill and Ted movies. It was that absurd and borderline satirical. It doesn’t help, that there is a whole heap of plot holes the DLC introduces, so grave that even the people who liked Infinite are bothered. I just don’t care at this point. For me, Bioshock ended with really underrated Bioshock 2.

Öncelikle diğer 2 oyundaki gibi "Rapture" şehrinde geçmiyor oyunumuz. Kendisi Columbia denilen bulutların arasında süzülen bir şehirde geçiyor. Şehrin kendisi ne kadar güzel olsa da yanlış yönetim ile beyni yıkanan halka sahip. Gelelim karakterimize,
adımız Booker DeWitt. Savaş gazisi,karısını kaybetmiş, kızını kumarda kaybetmiş yıkık bir adamı oynuyoruz. Oyundaki amacımız ise Columbia`dan Elizabeth Comstock adındaki kardeşimizi götürüp kumar borcumuzu kapatmaya çalışıyoruz. İşte tam olarak olaylar burada başlıyor...

Sıra teknik özelliklerde.

Müzikler 10/8 (Diğer oyunlardaki gibi atmosferi yakalıyan müziklere ve seslere sahip.)

Grafikler 10/10 (Kendine özgü grafikleri var.)

Oynanış 10/10 (Vur geç mantığında kesinlikle değil aksine oldukça fazla seçeneğe sahip)

Hikaye  10/10 (Eğer bu oyunu "BioShock: The Collection" paketinden edindiyseniz veya diğer oyunlara sahipseniz ilk olarak Infinite sırasıyla 1-2 şeklinde bioshock hikayesini bitirmeniz gerekir. Ayrıca oynadığım en iyi ve derin hikayeye sahip olabilir Bioshock Infinite.)

Alınır mı? tek kelime ile evet.

I don't understand people who say this is worse than Bioshock 1. Bioshock had a lot of problems, and this fixes all of them.

Set aside the amazing art and story, Bioshock 1 was 15 or so hours of the exact same tedious combat against the exact same enemies in the exact same environments.

Bioshock Infinite does infinitely better in this regard (bad pun). There's a much larger variety of far more interesting enemies, the environments you fight in are more varied and interesting, the combat is fun and engaging.

As for the story, the hallmark of every Bioshock game, I think it's about as good as the original Bioshock's story, albeit with a few plotholes.

Also the theory that this game's meta narrative is that people need to stop making games like Bioshock is just stupid. If we stopped making things that are like other things we'd stop making things altogether.

Esta ves no nos encontramos en Rapture, en lugar de ello ascenderemos a una ciudad en el cielo donde nos encontraremos con una chica la cual tenemos que llevar de regreso para saldar una deuda, cambios sustanciales en la jugabilidad como las armas, que son totalmente diferentes a las anteriores entregas y que en ves de ir con todas las diferentes tipos de armas que nos encontramos en el camino, esta ves solo podremos cargar con dos al mismo tiempo haciendo que el gameplay cambie dependiendo de las armas que nos gusten, he incluso algunas veces cambiarlas porque no hay municion en la zona, aqui en vez de plasmidos inyectados en nuestro brazo, nos encontraremos con botellas que al ser ingenridas nos otorgaran habilidades parecidas, pero totalmente nuevas y algunas con diferentes usos, el gamplay en vez de ser mas pausado y con un poco de terror, sera mas frenetico como un shooter normal, lo cual no es malo, ya que todos estos elementos calzan perfectos con la ambientacion, ademas de los DLC en los cuales podremos usar un personaje diferente, nuevos enemigos y un mundo totalmente nuevo, ademas de zonas mas abiertas y rieles donde nos podremos colgar para hacer asesinatos aereos, final un tanto confuso pero que no por ello lo hace un mal juego, y a pesar de ello la hisotoria es bastante entretenida.
Juego 10/10 recomendadisimo si has jugado las anteriores entregas, y aun si nos los has jugados puede llegar a ser mas entretenido al este ser mas frenetico, recomiendo comprarlo en rebaja, y como en las anteriores comprar el pack si te interesa conocer el universo de Bioshock.

Hacı bu oyun mükemmel cidden mükemmel ancak şöyle bir tavsiyem var size ve bu tavsiyeye %100 güvenebilirsiniz şöyleki bu oyunu tek almak yerine Bioshock Collection paketini satın alın indirimde bioshock 1 ve 2 remastered ları ile infinite ise tüm dlc si ile 90 tl yerine 20 tl ye elinizde olur alıcaksanız detay larına bakarsınız zaten. Uzun lafın kısası bu oyunu tek almak yerine bioshock Collection paketini alın böylelikle dlc lerinide anlamış olursunuz sevgiler saygılar iyi günleriniz olsun

Самая слабая игра из серии, особенно сильные просадки в сюжете, слишком много сюжетных дыр, главный герой неуравновешенный идиот. Боевая система ощущается хуже всех остальных биошоков. Понимаю, что в основном люди воспевают эту игру, но для меня она самая слабая из всей серии.
Wallpaper Engine Simulator

很出色的一款游戏，无论是叙事还是画风和剧情，都是单机游戏中顶级的。
只是越接近结尾越觉得不舒服，怀念那个在沙滩起舞的伊莎贝尔，如果她什么都不知道，如果结局就在那一刻定格，那就好了。
缺点也很明显，战斗方式虽然多样但是节奏真的不好。全程缺钱缺弹药。喇叭怪那里我甚至是技能加上近战打过的，因为既不掉弹药也不掉枪械。这点玩着真是太难受了，作为一个fps游戏，多带几把枪总没有毛病吧。结果就两把，弹药上限也很低，这点玩着非常非常非常难受。
其他方面游戏做的非常出色，这款游戏告诉了我们，游戏作为第九艺术的魅力所在。

story of this game is beyond my words.
